newsitem.title: USA: U.S. cash crudes mixed, sour still under pressure.
newsitem.headline: U.S. cash crudes mixed, sour still under pressure.

text.p: U.S. cash crude grades talked late Thursday at mixed prices, weaker in the deflating sour crude market and steady for sweet barrels, traders said.

The dynamics in the sour market have become more bearish, with the emergence of Iraqi crude as a major drag in differentials. Offerings in the U.S. Gulf have further pressured West Texas Sour/Midland and Eugene Island grades, making the spot market an increasingly cheap venue for crude.
"We heard majors were in there selling the sours, possibly looking to get other crude (Iraqi cheaper)," said a trader.
Apr West Texas Intermediate ended 20 cts off at $20.80-90.
